Comment: It appears to have a functional TCA
Stated that it ferments glucose, and member of the same genus does not have TCA (Acholeplasma laidlawii)
Grown anaerobically and belong to spirochetes that are generally devoid of TCA.
Sensitive to CO and cyanide, oxygen is consumed, TCA enzymes are present albeit in lower quantities relative to two other Spirillum species
Majority of isolated spirochetes are fermenters.
